newsitem.title: LITHUANIA: WS DE BROE CONFIRMS AGREEMENT WITH HERMIS.
newsitem.headline: WS DE BROE CONFIRMS AGREEMENT WITH HERMIS.

text.p: Williams de Broe investment bank confirmed on Monday that it has signed an agreement with Lithuania's Hermis Bank over issuing part of its shares in global depository receipts GDRs.

"Williams de Broe signed an agreement with Hermis Bank with regards to the remaining shares from the rights issue of Hermis," the managing director of Williams de Broe for Baltic markets Petri Karjalainen told Reuters.

"We are looking to create a GDR facility for the bank in order to increase the level of knowledge of the bank as a way for international investors to invest into the shares of the bank," Karjalainen added.

Hermis Bank said earlier this year it had decided to boost its share capital by 23 million litas to 90 million litas and that 65 percent of the new issue was acquired by the current shareholders of the bank.
Hermis said earlier on Monday that it has signed an agreement with Williams De Broe to distribute the remaining eight million litas face value shares in GDRs.
"Hermis is a good quality bank with strong managment and good prospects for growth in the Lithuanian banking market," Karjalainen said.
"We also feel comfortably by the fact that European Bank for Reconstruction and Development has earlier participated as one of the key owners of Hermis Bank," Karjalainen added.
He also said that in this transaction Williams de Broe have been in co-operation with Lithuanian brokerage house Vilfima.
